de.unkrig.notemplate

Class NoTemplate

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.unkrig.notemplate.NoTemplate
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractBottomLeftFrameHtml, AbstractIndexHtml, AbstractRightFrameHtml, BottomHtml, HtmlTemplate, TopHtml

    public abstract class NoTemplate
extends java.lang.Object
    The heart of the No-Template library: Renders the templates that you define as Java™ classes ("template classes").

    The lifecycle of a template is as follows:

    • You create an instance of your template class by calling newTemplate(Class, Writer) (or one of its brethren).
    • You invoke the render method that you declared in your template class, passing all the dynamic data as arguments.
    • The render method of your class generates output by calling l(String...), p(String) (and their brethren). Optionally, it includes other templates by calling include(Class).
    • The render method of your class returns, and document generation is complete. Voila!

      • newTemplate

        public static final <T extends NoTemplate> T newTemplate(java.lang.Class<T> templateClass,
                                                         java.io.Writer out)
        Instantiates the given template class and returns the instance. Everything that the template instance will print (through l(String...) and its brethren) will be written to the given writer.

      • newTemplate

        public static final <T extends NoTemplate> T newTemplate(java.lang.Class<T> templateClass,
                                                         java.io.OutputStream os)
        Instantiates the given template class and returns the instance. Everything that the template instance will print (through l(String...) and its brethren) will be written to the given output stream, encoded according to the "platform default encoding".

      • newTemplate

        public static final <T extends NoTemplate> T newTemplate(java.lang.Class<T> templateClass,
                                                         java.io.OutputStream os,
                                                         java.nio.charset.Charset cs)
        Instantiates the given template class and returns the instance. Everything that the template instance will print (through l(String...) and its brethren) will be written to the given output stream, encoded according to the given charset.

      • include

        public <C extends NoTemplate> C include(java.lang.Class<C> templateClass)
        Instantiates the given template class and returns the template instance. Everything that the template instance will print, will be written to the same destination as for this template instance.

        public static java.lang.String html(java.lang.String s)

      • l

        public void l(java.lang.String line)
        Writes a String and then terminates the line. Invoking this method is equivalent with

        Invoking this method is equivalent with 

             this.p(text);
     this.l();

      • l

        public void l(java.lang.String... lines)
        Writes the given lines, and a line separator after each line.

        Invoking this method is equivalent with: 

           for (String line : lines) {
       this.p(line);
       this.l();
   }

      • p

        public void p(java.lang.String text)
        Writes a string (but not a following line separator).

      • once

        public static NoTemplate.Once once()
        Returns:
        An object which produces the value true exactly once, and then always false
